div1.p: It has been over two years since I sat in awed silence listening to your lectures in "Critical Essay" at the University. But in that space of time I have never forgotten the intellectual impact you made on me.

After perusing the enclosed article in today's Post-Dispatch I felt I had to share it with you since you first instilled my interest in the subject. One of my assignments while in your class was to analyze a book called "Phantom Wells." I'll never forget the trip to your lovely farm to get the book. You graciously "showed me around" the stables and house. What a pleasant experience!

I'm sure I made a shambles of my assignment but you never let it be known to me. Bless you for your patience. Some of my other assignments in your class were "The Precious Bane" and "The Grapes of Wrath." I mention these only in the hope that they will help you to remember a far from impressionable student--but you did give me an E in the course. This did impress me coming from what I consider one of the finest minds in the country today.
I hope I haven't taken too much of your time with reminiscences. And I especially hope I haven't been too presumptuous.
Please take this minute token of appreciation (the enclosed article) for all the inspiration you have given me during our fall term relationship.

closer.salute: Kindest personal regards, from A former student
